definition: locomotive/train engine car/scooter (Tw)/(slang) (Tw) hard to get along with/a pain in the ass/damn!/crap!
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Motorcyclists and bicyclists are often the victims in such cases.
sentences.chinese: 機車與腳踏車騎士常常是這種狀況的犧牲者。

sentences.english: A cab was provided for driver and fireman, as in normal railway practice .
sentences.chinese: 按通常的鐵路慣例，機車備有司機和司爐室。

sentences.english: Continuous display of cab signals are put on wherever the train goes.
sentences.chinese: 列車無論在任何區段上機車信號連續顯示等優點。

sentences.english: I'll be sitting in the third carriage from the engine.
sentences.chinese: 我將坐在機車後面的第三節車廂內。

sentences.english: Another vehicle on road will increase traffic jamm ???
sentences.chinese: 公路上又多了一種機車，會加劇交通擁堵的？

sentences.english: If we had a scooter we would be able to nose through the traffic.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們有小機車，就可慢慢的鑽過車陣了。

sentences.english: President Chou Protects Patty Hou and Wrecks Paparazzis' Motorcycle?
Zhuzhou Electric Locomotive could not be reached for comment Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 記者週四無法聯繫株洲電力機車公司就此置評。

sentences.english: KN-2 is running at circle line of Chi-Chi Town, Nan-Tou County.
sentences.chinese: 滂沱大雨中行駛於集集環鎮鐵路的慶仁2號蒸氣機車。

sentences.english: Hungarian V43 EL was standing-by at the border of Austria and Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 奧匈邊境等待上陣的匈牙利V43型電力機車。

sentences.english: The efficiency of mining locomotive was improved as well as loaded performance.
sentences.chinese: 該系統機車效率高，帶負載能力顯著增強。

sentences.english: A patrol car and a DL have been displayed at Hsi-Hu Station.
sentences.chinese: 展示於溪湖糖廠內車站股道的機車與巡道車。

sentences.english: But most of the trains were built in China.
sentences.chinese: 但大部分機車在是中國建造。

sentences.english: A major potential for cost saving lies in vehicles' electrical equipment.
sentences.chinese: 在降低成本方面，機車車輛電氣裝置中有很大潛力。

sentences.english: The No. 1 locomotive of Ruey-Fang Gold Mine.
sentences.chinese: 瑞芳金礦九號洞所使用的1號機車。

sentences.english: I can't believe you never learned how to ride a scooter .
sentences.chinese: 我真不敢相信你從來沒學過騎機車。

definition: to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
